security.title: Security & Architecture
security.description: All tunnels use encrypted SSH connections. No need to open public ports on your local network. The reverse tunnel allows only the authorized VPS to access your OData. JWT-Based Authentication with Bearer Tokens and secure token signing for protected endpoints.

howItWorks.title: How it Works
howItWorks.subtitle: Get your OData API up and running in just a few simple steps.

step1.title: 1. Configure
step1.description: Edit config.json to set up your database connection (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MSSQL) and server settings.

step2.title: 2. Connect
step2.description: Use the GUI to select your database dialect and establish a secure connection via SSH tunnel if needed.

step3.title: 3. Start Server
step3.description: Launch the Waitress server with a single click. Access your API at localhost or configure HTTPS proxy.

step4.title: 4. Query
step4.description: Use OData syntax to query your data: $select, $filter, $top, $orderby. Insert and update via JSON.

newFeatures.description: Custom SQL-based Data Access Layer for improved concurrency. Native DB drivers with explicit pooling. JWT-Based Authentication. HTTPS Proxy integration. Cross-platform compatibility (Windows/Linux x64).

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about PulseConnector.

q1.question: What databases does PulseConnector support?
q1.answer: PulseConnector supports MySQL, MariaDB, PostgreSQL, and Microsoft SQL Server. You can easily switch between databases by changing the active_dialect in your config.json file.

q2.question: How do I secure my database connection?
q2.answer: PulseConnector provides built-in SSH tunnels for secure connectivity. All tunnels use encrypted SSH connections, so you don't need to open public ports on your local network. Additionally, JWT-based authentication protects your OData endpoints.

q3.question: What OData operations are supported?
q3.answer: PulseConnector supports $select, $filter, $top, and $orderby for queries. Filter operators include eq, ne, gt, lt, ge, le, and like. You can also perform INSERT (POST), full UPDATE (PUT), and partial UPDATE (PATCH) operations via JSON.

q4.question: Which platforms are supported?
q4.answer: PulseConnector is compatible with Windows and Linux x64 systems. The package installation includes embedded libraries, and the lightweight Waitress backend ensures consistent performance across both platforms.

q5.question: Is PulseConnector free to use?
q5.answer: Yes, PulseConnector is free for non-commercial use. Commercial use requires prior written authorization from the author. Contact us for commercial licensing options.
